choices.A: In Scheduler Services, restart user merge.
choices.C: In Directory Services, enable auto sync.
choices.B: In Directory Services, enable auto merge.
choices.D: In Scheduler Services, restart user sync.

questions.question_text:
An administrator is seeing user attributes not updating in the Workspace ONE UEM console automatically.
What can resolve the issue?

discussion.content:
answer is B 
Auto Merge Changes Enable this option to apply sync changes automatically from the database without administrative approval.

Correct Answer: B
https://docs.vmware.com/en/VMware-Workspace-ONE-UEM/services/Directory_Service_Integration/GUID-AWT-SETUPDIRSVCMANUALLY.html#:~:text=Attributes%20sync%20automatically%20on%20the,Group%20and%20configure%20Group%20settings.
Auto Merge: Enable setting to allow user group updates from your directory service to merge with the associated users and groups in Workspace ONE UEM automatically.

where as Auto Sync Default : Select this checkbox to automatically add or remove users in Workspace ONE UEM configured user groups based on their membership in your directory service.

i believe it should be: D
https://docs.vmware.com/en/VMware-Workspace-ONE-UEM/2005/Tunnel_Linux/GUID-AWT-SSLOFFLOADING.html
"SSL Offloading and SSL re-encryption is not supported for the Per-App Tunnel"

The Answer is: C
Load Balancer Checklist for Tunnel Service
Before diving into the load balancer requirements, the following checklist contains the recommended load balancer settings to properly handle the Tunnel traffic on Unified Access Gateway.
SSL Requirement Passthrough

https://techzone.vmware.com/understand-and-troubleshoot-tunnel-connections#ssl-offloading-and-ssl-re-encryption
"SSL Offloading and SSL re-encryption are not supported and must be turned off."

B is correct.
The SEG on UAG does not support a non-SSL configuration. If the SSL traffic from a device is offloaded on a Load Balancer or F5 network, the SEG must be configured with any SSL certificate to ensure that the traffic reaching the SEG from these network components is encrypted. In such a scenario, the SSL certificate rotation for SEG is applicable as explained in the Upload the SSL Certificate Locally For SEG Edge Service on the UAG Admin UI section.
https://docs.vmware.com/en/VMware-Workspace-ONE-UEM/2011/WS1-Secure-Email-Gateway/GUID-D71CBEF1-3754-4362-95EE-15B269E68B61.html
based on my experience, it should be D.... had faced this issue in production, moving to SSL pass through resolved my issue

The Answer should be B. "Unified Access Gateway appliances work with standard third-party load balancing solutions that are configured for HTTPS."
https://docs.vmware.com/en/Unified-Access-Gateway/3.3/com.vmware.uag-33-deploy-config.doc/GUID-9B1FB477-A1E0-4617-BCBF-726867210AD8.html

comments.content: I think you're on the right track here, but the answer should be passthrough. Offloading SSL would change the headers. I believe best practice here is Passthrough - D.

discussion.content:
I believe answer is C - SSL Offloading. 

https://docs.vmware.com/en/Unified-Access-Gateway/2009/uag-deploy-config/GUID-9B1FB477-A1E0-4617-BCBF-726867210AD8.html

Configure the load balancers to Send Original HTTP Headers to avoid device connectivity problems. Content Gateway and Tunnel Proxy use information in the request's HTTP header to authenticate devices.

questions.question_text: When using a third party load balancer to provide the tunnel service on the Unified Access Gateway (UAG), what should the SSL setting be on the load balancer?

discussion.content:
Correct: A
Tunnel Proxy is either Basic Deployment - Endpoint (in the DMZ) or Relay-Endpoint (in the DMZ and in the internal network) - https://docs.vmware.com/en/Unified-Access-Gateway/2009/uag-deploy-config/GUID-913ED08B-2965-4472-ADAE-1A4710A0D5DC.html

 Only the Backend Server is always in the internal network - hence A is correct

comments.content: The correct answer is A as proxy tunnel is basic deployment with one UAG which resides in DMZ

questions.question_text:
An organization has a split network comprised of a DMZ and an internal network.
Which Workspace ONE UEM edge service does VMware recommend to be deployed within the organization's internal network?

choices.C: VMware Unified Access Gateway with (VMware Tunnel Front-End)
choices.D: VMware Unified Access Gateway with (SEG v2)
choices.A: VMware Unified Access Gateway with (VMware Tunnel Back-End)
choices.B: VMware Unified Access Gateway with (VMware Tunnel Proxy)

questions.question_text:
An administrator is tasked with determining the root cause for a recent outage where devices were not able to authenticate. An investigation revealed a single
AirWatch Cloud Connector (ACC) server that had a disk error which caused it to be completely unresponsive.
Which VMware resiliency recommendation would have prevented this outage?

comments.content: yes agreed, very clearly explained. thank

discussion.content: A single point of failure becomes more resilient with High Availability - Correct: D

comments.content: A B C or A B D ?

discussion.content:
Correct:
A - Device Ownership - https://docs.vmware.com/en/VMware-Workspace-ONE-UEM/1907/System_Settings_On_Prem/GUID-AWT-DEVICESUSERS-GENERAL-ENROLL.html
B - User Groups - https://docs.vmware.com/en/VMware-Workspace-ONE-UEM/services/Directory_Service_Integration/GUID-AWT-MAPPING-GROUPS.html
D - Device Type - https://docs.vmware.com/en/VMware-Workspace-ONE-UEM/1907/UEM_Managing_Devices/GUID-AWT-CONFIGUREENROLLMENTOPTIONS.html

I think A B E are correct.

Device ownership and IP range: https://docs.vmware.com/en/VMware-Workspace-ONE-UEM/2011/UEM_Managing_Devices/GUID-AWT-ENABLEDEVICEASSIGNMENTS.html
"Organization Group By IP Range â€“ Moves the device to a specified OG when the device leaves one Wi-Fi network range and enters another. This move triggers the automatic push of profiles, apps, policies, and products."
"Choose the Device Ownership options. Only devices with the selected ownership types are assigned"

User group: https://docs.vmware.com/en/VMware-Workspace-ONE-UEM/2011/UEM_Managing_Devices/GUID-AWT-CONFIGUREENROLLMENTOPTIONSONGROUPINGTAB.html#GUID-AWT-CONFIGUREENROLLMENTOPTIONSONGROUPINGTAB
"Automatically Select Based on User Group - This option only applies if you are integrating with user groups. Enable this option to ensure that users are automatically assigned to organization groups based on their directory service group assignments."

questions.question_text:
When using Workspace ONE 20.01 and higher, which three ways can an administrator using UEM automatically move devices into specified organization groups?
(Choose three.)
